Package image.model

Class ImageUtil

java.lang.Object
image.model.ImageUtil
public class ImageUtil
extends java.lang.Object
This class contains utility methods to read an model from file and write to a file.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static int getHeight​(java.lang.String filename)
    Convenience function to get the height of an model.
    static int getWidth​(java.lang.String filename)
    Convenience function to get the width of an model.
    static int[][][] readImage​(java.lang.String filename)
    Read an model file and return the contents as an array.
    static void writeImage​(int[][][] rgb, int width, int height, java.lang.String filename)
    Write an model to a file in a given format.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Method Details

    • readImage

      public static int[][][] readImage​(java.lang.String filename) throws java.io.IOException
      Read an model file and return the contents as an array.
      Parameters:
      filename - the path of the file. Look at the ImageIO documentation to see which file formats are supported.
      Returns:
      the model as a 3D array of integer values
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • getWidth

      public static int getWidth​(java.lang.String filename) throws java.io.IOException
      Convenience function to get the width of an model.
      Parameters:
      filename - the full path of the model file. Look at the ImageIO class to see which file formats are supported
      Returns:
      the width of the file
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if the file is not found

    • getHeight

      public static int getHeight​(java.lang.String filename) throws java.io.IOException
      Convenience function to get the height of an model.
      Parameters:
      filename - the full path of the model file. Look at the ImageIO class to see which file formats are supported
      Returns:
      the height of the file
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if the file is not found

    • writeImage

      public static void writeImage​(int[][][] rgb, int width, int height, java.lang.String filename) throws java.io.IOException
      Write an model to a file in a given format.
      Parameters:
      rgb - the model data as a 3D array of integers. The dimensions are row, col and channel respectively
      width - the width of the model
      height - the height of the model
      filename - the full path of where the model must be stored. This should include the name and extension of the file
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if the file cannot be written to the provided path
